title.narrative: Social Change Through Creativity and Culture (Brazil)

description.narrative: The project will develop ideas and key issues arising from the Creative Lab on "Social Change through Creativity and Culture" held in Rio de Janeiro in October 2015. The Lab offered participants the opportunity to build project teams and at the end, creative project ideas were presented to a group of mentors and advisors who gave feedback. Participants will now have the opportunity to apply to QMUL/PPP for direct project funding to refine their ideas and develop them further. It will: * Support communication structures between November 2015-March 2016, providing translation and convening regular meetings between between the 20 Creative Lab participants, to support the continuing work of partnerships and working teams formed at the Creative Lab * Set up and run a project grant application process to award individual grants to teams for the direct costs of making an anticipated 4-5 projects to be shown publicly in Rio's Multiplicity/Multiplicidade Festival in 2016, setting appropriate grant reporting structures in place * provide infrastructure staffing and central resourcing (such as venues for making, equipment, etc) to support producing/production of the projects within Multiplicidade Festival 2016 in Rio de Janeiro * provide a return visit to Rio de Janeiro for the UK participants to sustain their contribution to the project outcomes.

capital-spend.percentage: The project "Social Change through Creativity and Culture - Brazil" includes activities under the RESEARCH and TRANSLATION activity headings of the Newton Fund and provides a second stage of work to follow the ten day Creative Lab phase from 24 October-5 November 2015. The second stage objectives are to: * Continue to stimulate UK-Brazil research collaboration focused around Development challenges in the specific context of Brazil / Rio de Janeiro by maintaining communication networks and structures between the teams formed at the Creative Lab * Support the translation of research by providing appropriate resources (partnerships, staffing, resources including funding) to Creative Lab participant teams to realise projects that harness creativity and culture to offer solutions to development challenges * Enable the production of 4-5 new small research projects in creative disciplines that offer potential solutions to development challenges in Brazil, focusing on: - urban migration / the inequality legacies of historical migration, human rights, social welfare, visibility and civic participation of underrepresented groups; - governance, society and conflict, civil society, effective institutions, state violence, structural inequalities and urban violence; - urban transformation; - inclusive economic growth * Build research and innovation capacity in Brazil by providing continuing opportunities for Brazilian researchers to work with and learn from UK researchers, and with creative entrepreneurs from both UK and Brazil * Maximise the potential future commercial collaborations generated between UK and Brazilian academics and creatives, and demonstrating good reasons the UK should be a partner of choice for Brazil, by: - including Brazilian creative entrepreneurs, community-based SMEs, NGOs and commercial organisations as active members in the partnership network; - working sensitively and with a deep understanding of the context based on QMUL's/People's Palace Projects' 15 years of work in Brazil and on CreativeWorks London's expertise in stimulating and supporting research partnerships with creative innovation; - brokering stimulating and appropriate matches of skills and research specialisms in the UK with researchers and creatives who are producing new innovations and solutions in the profusely creative context of Rio de Janeiro/Brazil * Draw on a network of partnerships established by People's Palace Projects at QMUL and People's Palace Projects do Brasil, introducing new Co-Investigator academics and UK creative entrepreneurs to these established partnerships to lay foundations for on-going collaborations beyond the timeframe of the project * Strengthen pathways to impact from the original research by providing a public platform for the research outcomes to be seen at Multiplicidade Festival in Rio de Janeiro during May 2016 * Document and evaluate the process with the aim of enabling it to be assessed and built on as a model for future AHRC Creative Labs.
